intro: Rosa arvensis var. glabrifolia, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed dog玫瑰, is a perennial shrub native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides. The plant features slender, often glabrous stems and small, pinnately compound leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to red, with five petals and numerous stamens, typical of the Rosa genus. It produces oval, woody follicles that contain several seeds, aiding in its propagation.
